rationale: The agent's implementation is fundamentally incorrect and incomplete. The ground truth shows reverting to 0.90.7 format by: (1) changing fromXContent to fromXContentStandalone in MetaDataCreateIndexService.java:485, (2) updating test file template0-2.json to wrap templates in an outer object with 'template_1' key, and (3) fixing the random template selection range from randomInt(1) to randomInt(2) in the test. The agent only modified MetaDataCreateIndexService.java by adding manual parsing logic with START_OBJECT/FIELD_NAME handling, but completely omitted all three critical test file changes (template0.json, template1.json, template2.json structure updates and the randomInt fix in IndexTemplateFileLoadingTests.java). The agent's approach of manually parsing the outer wrapper is more complex than the ground truth's simple method call change (fromXContentStandalone exists to handle this exact case). Without the test file changes, the templates would have the wrong format and tests would fail. This represents a major misunderstanding of the revert requirement.
